pullRequest.body:
`Polynomial.coeffList` is the list of coefficients, in descending order from leading term to constant term. (The zero polynomial has coeffList of `[]`). The PR defines coeffList and proves some basic facts, notably relating `P.coeffList` to `P.eraseLead.coeffList`.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

- [x] depends on: #9082 
- [x] depends on: #9083

Part of #9052.

### PR summary [cb541a930c](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/9085/commits/cb541a930cb843c38164cd3bf3f0d7ff6da1fd66)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Algebra.Polynomial.CoeffList` (new file)|882|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ coeffList`
`+ coeffList_C`
`+ coeffList_C_mul`
`+ coeffList_eq_cons_leadingCoeff`
`+ coeffList_eq_nil_iff`
`+ coeffList_eraseLead`
`+ coeffList_monomial`
`+ coeffList_neg`
`+ coeffList_of_ne_zero`
`+ coeffList_of_nextCoeff_ne_zero`
`+ coeffList_zero`
`+ head?_coeffList_eq_leadingCoeff`
`+ head_coeffList_eq_leadingCoeff`
`+ length_coeffList`
`+ length_coeffList_support`
`+ natDegree_C_mul_of_nonzero`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
So the stuff in EraseLead and Unbundled was all from #9082 and #9083, which this was building on, it had just been so long I forgot which was where. I cleared that out from this commit
Thanks! A first batch of comments below - please don't take them as discouraging.
Thanks! A first batch of comments below - please don't take them as discouraging.

```suggestion
  relation is the (classical) logical negation of a transitive relation. In other words,
```
This does not appear to be used in this PR; I suggest you split it out if you need it elsewhere.
Oops, yes. I was using it an earlier draft, but (since get! is now not used the same way in Mathlib) in my cleanup I no longer needed it.
Please revert
These should be bundled into an iff as well
Why η as variable name?
Because this came out of another earlier project where I was following another given proof, and this was η -- so, no reason now. Changed to "x". :)

```suggestion
    ∃ ls : List α, P.coeffList = P.leadingCoeff :: ls := by
```
Let's add a variant with `List.head` too
Added `List.head` and `List.head?`
... plus one

I think
```suggestion
    P.coeffList.length = if P = 0 then 0 else P.natDegree + 1 := by
```

So I actually did it with P.support instead of P = 0, so that this whole file can be done without needing DecidableEq α. So I'll keep this version (and name it `..._support`, but add a separate one with DecidableEq and a zero condition.

Probably
```suggestion
  constructor <;>
  · intros
    exact (Polynomial.eraseLead_coeff_of_ne _ (by linarith)).symm
```
or
```suggestion
  constructor <;> intros <;>
    exact (Polynomial.eraseLead_coeff_of_ne _ (by linarith)).symm
```
Swap the sides so you can use \le
You're not using `get!`
I'm not convinced we want to use `getElem!` in mathlib either

```suggestion
    rw [List.getElem?_cons_succ, List.getElem?_reverse (by simpa [hd] using hnp),
```
This proof is quite long and hard to follow. Is there anything you could split out?

I don't see anything that I easily could. But changing get! and getElem! to getElem? did make the proof shorter, and I put in some work to try to do better parallel structure on the cases. It's a bit shorter now.
One option would be to split out the case where `P` is a monomial into a separate lemma (e.g., `coeffList_monomial`) and use that to shorten that branch of the proof.
Alright, I split that off, it did get a bit better.
Shadowing variables isn't great. I suggest putting `{α : Type*}` at the type and adding `Semiring` and `Ring` sections

```suggestion
  · simp only [hp, mul_zero, natDegree_zero]
  · rw [← zero_add p.natDegree, ← natDegree_C a]
```

```suggestion
    simp [ha, hp]
```
or
```suggestion
    simp only [leadingCoeff_C, ne_eq, mul_eq_zero, ha, leadingCoeff_eq_zero, hp, or_self,
      not_false_eq_true]
```
if you prefer

Stylistically:
```suggestion
  set c := f.support.card with hc
  cases h₁ : c
  case zero => by_contra; exact h (card_support_eq_zero.mp h₁)
  case succ => exact Nat.succ_inj'.mpr (card_support_eraseLead' (hc ▸ h₁))
```
but simpler as:
```suggestion
  have h₁ : f.support.card ≠ 0 := by simpa
  obtain ⟨c, hc⟩ := Nat.exists_eq_add_one_of_ne_zero h₁
  rw [hc, card_support_eraseLead' hc]
```
This is already `Polynomial.two_le_natDegree_of_nextCoeff_eraseLead`

```suggestion
  mt nextCoeff_eq_zero_of_eraseLead_eq_zero h
```

```suggestion
theorem eraseLead_ne_zero_of_nextCoeff_ne_zero (h : f.nextCoeff ≠ 0) : f.eraseLead ≠ 0 :=
```
Are the changes in this file necessary? If not, please split out
Oops, this was from an old way of talking about them that we got rid of. Right. Yes, don't need these
le

I don't think this docstring adds anything compared to the type.
```suggestion
```
I would inline this into the `iff` version below.

```suggestion
theorem coeffList_eq_nil_iff (P : α[X]) : P.coeffList = [] ↔ P = 0 :=
```

```suggestion
```

```suggestion
theorem natDegree_C_mul_of_nonzero (ha : a ≠ 0) : natDegree (C a * p) = p.natDegree := by
```

This name suggests that you are multiplying with `C x` on the right.
```suggestion
theorem coeffList_C_mul {x : α} (hη : x ≠ 0) : (C x * P).coeffList = P.coeffList.map (x * ·) := by
```

pullRequest.title: feat: `Polynomial.coeffList`

source.title: Lemmas for Descartes' Rule of Signs. Notably `coeffList` and `IsCoequiv` as new defs.
